DOC.brief_summary: The main objective study gather preliminary data effectiveness High Flow Nasal canula ( HFNC ) , provide since delivery room , ventilatory support newborn 34-36 week moderate respiratory distress syndrome ( RDS ) . The secondary objective evaluate safety HFNC indication .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Tolerance High Flow Nasal Cannula Respiratory Distress Syndrom Late Preterms ( 34-36 Weeks )
DOC.detailed_description: Treatment HFNC start maximum 30 minute birth initial flow rate 2L/Kg/min . According retraction sign , flow may increase gradual increment 1L/min reach maximum flow rate 5L/kg/minute . Patients improve 2 hour support HFBNC hospitalize neonatal intensive care unit ( NICU ) , HFNC maintain long necessary , regular attempt wean . At moment study , aggravation lead stop HFNC trial , infant management decide physician involved patient 's care . Aggravation definined one follow condition : Silverman-Anderson score > 6 , / FiO2 > 0.5 / severe apneas / hemodynamic instability .
DOC.criteria: Newborn premature 34 36 week gestational age Moderate RDS 30 minute life treat + 5cm H2O positive airway pressure Presence dedicate pediatric nurse pediatrician Parental consent Need early intubation Severe RDS , define one following : SilvermanAnderson score > 6 , severe hypoxia ( FiO2 > 0.5 ) , hemodynamic disorder ( HR > 180 / min , MABP < 30mmHg , capillary refill time > 5 , pallor ) , severe apnea ( > 5 / bradycardia < 80 /min ) 1 minute Apgar score < 3 / five minute Apgar score < 7 Birth weight < 1800g / IUGR < 2 SD Congenital heart , pulmonary , facial , digestive malformation Subject affiliate social security system Legal representative unable understand term study
